title: Just be prepared. Read this review
review: I normally read a number of reviews before I start tapping away. Of those I read, although some good points I feel clarification is in order.  OK main point, very important. This is not all inclusive, at best it's full board with some free drinks for 12 hours. 11am to 11pm. Outside of these times you need to pay for anything, including coffee and water. Get used to this and it will be ok.  Meals:  The hotel is predominantly Spanish occupation. So the menu choices at the buffet are probably different to what you expected. The food is edible and varied but you need to be prepared to experiment. You won't see a lot of English cuisine. Breakfast is not great and the choices limited and often colder than required. But you can eat cold meats, cheese, yogurt and pastries. Plenty of fruit available. They need to up their game here a bit. But if your prepared is ok.  Pool: Not for children, no shallow end. No diving or jumping or any horseplay Very strict not much fun.  Entertainment: Same problem and the food. It's geared around local tastes.  Now very odd. They have various entertainment such as bingo, dance class and karaoke. Bingo you play for a small necklace about 2 Euro and a cocktail you must drink there and then.  Board games, now this is a puzzler.  You have a selection of board games but.....you can not play them in the  bar, you must go elsewhere. Very strange. But if you accept this it's ok.  Now the overall bit. The hotel is clean. The rooms are clean and well kept. The staff can be a little grumpy so what. They are working your not. WiFi.... forget it and don't pay for it. It's very poor.  Location. 20 mins walk from anywhere and a LOT of hills. But taxis are cheap and very quick to come.  It's a cheap holiday in a back street. It's not horrible and if you accept the way things are you will have a decent time  Is it a 3 star hotel.  No I have stayed in better 2 star. Is that a problem. No.…

title: Very friendly 😀
review: I believe in starting how I mean to go on. In that spirit, upon entering the Hotel Perla you are given you're room key, hotel information and a welcome note.   THAT note was the most welcome we felt our entire stay.   We were constantly looked down on by the elderly guests the entire time. Had we known younger guests weren't wanted at the hotel we would have booked elsewhere but there was no information to state this. All but two of the staff members were miserable. The nice ones being the bartender Diego and the lifeguard James. The other staff were awful though, in particular one of the other barmen who's name no one would ever give me and sadly the only way I can describe him is bald and rotund.  He was always looking at us as if we were something he stepped on, constantly making us feel like were a nuisance just for asking for a coffee (which takes about four seconds to make) and even going so far as to talk s*** about us right Infront of us. He assumed we spoke no Spanish. He was wrong! But the most insulted we felt is when he mocked us for saying gracias each time he served us. I apologise but my mother raised me with manners. He shook his head at us and said "gracias, always gracias" which may be confusing to read but in the context of the moment it was clearly a dig. Hi is without doubt the worst employee there.  I understand that they may not be used to having seven men all staying together. All of varying ages but it was my cousin's 21st birthday and so we came to this beautiful island to make the day special for him.  We realised early on that the younger members of the group required some looking after and so to appease the other guests we made sure each time we went to the bar we went outside and sat right down at the bottom, past the pool where no one else sat just so we were out the way.  The music was dated and very loud and is more catered to dancing in groups. So in our little corner we put our own music on and being Brits we like a good sing along. This just led to more dirty looks. EVEN on the nights when just two of us would go up and have a friendly game of pool (they were actually snooker balls on a pool table but that's neither here nor there) we were still treated like crap.   The worst part is we were unaware of the hotel's feelings about us because nobody said anything to us until day six when another British guest approached us and said that they had approached him and asked him to ask us to keep it down. At the time they asked him, he refused to do so as he was just one man with his wife and we were seven men and while I'll argue that we are in no way intimidating, neither are we particularly small. It was not his responsibility to talk to us. That lies solely with the hotel!  I don't want to go on too much longer but to sum up:  From our experience The Hotel Perla has 'ok' catering but it's hospitality is practically none existent.   The food is varied but the temperature is all over the place and there's not really anything that can be made into a meal. It's just random.  The same applies to the house keeping. My room was serviced every day and by that I mean they made the bed and closed the curtains. That was the extent of it. But my cousin's room next to mine wasn't serviced once despite having the please service sign on the door the whole time.  I've worked in the catering and hospitality sector for years now and I would never dream of treating anyone the way we were treated. Everyone has bad days but it's called putting on a happy face.   I will definitely come to the beautiful canary islands again but I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THE HOTEL PERLA!  Hotel aside we had a great time in a beautiful location and I would recommend it to everyone.…

title: Dated decor and not family friendly...
review: After reading the very negative reviews on here I was initially unsure what to expect! I’m going to be as honest as possible. What everyone needs to remember about Hotel Perla is that it’s only a 3 star hotel and is very competitively priced! The rooms are basic with a small ceiling fan which would probably be not cool enough in high season but adequate for November. Maid service was daily and cleaned to a very high standard. Beds were comfortable and there was a fridge in the room. No tea, coffee or kettle but that didn’t bother me. We were on floor 5 which was perfect, I would recommend asking for a high floor. Breakfast, lunch and evening meals were all really nice! A great selection so you would have to be really picky not to find anything to eat. Kitchen staff and waiters/waitresses were all really friendly (some other guests were quite miserable but hey that happens everywhere) the hotel had mainly German , Spanish, Dutch guests. Not many English at all but again that suited me. There is nothing here for children but again that was another plus point! The main thing that lets this hotel down was poor entertainment but apart from that we had a lovely stay. Barman Pablo was excellent and always happy to help! All staff we encountered at this hotel were very helpful, the reception staff too were extremely nice.. all in all it was a very reasonably priced week away 😀…

title: Superb value, great staff.
review: I've come to the end of a great two week stay at this hotel. I am a regular visitor now having first booked at random a couple of years ago because of the price. As always the staff looked after me very well especially Diego in the bar. The rooms are kept immaculately clean. The food is good and I'd gonas far to describe the breakfast as excellent. Please ignore the negative reviews, whilst this hotel doesn't have the bells and whistles that some others do in the area, this is reflected in the price and you get excellent value for money. I've already booked to come back in January next year and look forward to seeing all the staff again then.

title: cheap and friendly
review: Stayed here for a week with my fiancée and we were not happy with service apart from one nice waitress  and one bar man think his names diago and a nice cleaner the rest were rude and generally unhelpful don’t seem to like the English if your German/Spanish you will fit in well rooms were adequate but no air con other than a ceiling fan all inclusive deal was terrible 11-11 never heard of that and there was strict rules don’t cater well for families should be advertised as an older adult hotel food well if you like to eat rabbit and a lot of fish then that’s fine not much variety jacuzzi didn’t work and no sun beds by pool even one of barmen asked if we were leaving soon said good when I said in a day very rude need customer service training would definitely not recommend this…

review: Dear guest. We apologize for any inconvenience you had during your stay. As for what concerns our staff, we will notify your comments to the person in charge, to take the appropriate actions. Thanks for your opinion.

title: Good cheap break
review: Once again a great hotel. Staff are impeccable and eager to help always friendly. Antonio as ever a gentlemen. If you ask you receive.whatever you're requirements the staff will endeavour to fulfil.nothing is too much trouble at this quaint hotel. Little things still need addressing. Aircon. More Spanish food. Free wi fi. Free safe deposit box. Sat TV would be nice. All inclusive pints would be nice as you're forever going to the bar which annoys the bar staff. Over all a Fantastic Hotel. I would like to thank Antonio and his staff for making my mum my brother and I so welcome. Were are booking again next year for 3 weeks. Can't wait to see all the staff yet again for the 3rd time. A very big thank you to Perla Hotel and its staff. See you soon my friends. Kind regards Take…

title: Ignore the bad reviews
review: We arrived at this hotel early hours Sunday morning, greeted by a lovely guy on reception called David. He made us feel extremely welcome from the get go and they had laid on some food and drink in case we needed it. We booked two rooms and I had emailed before we left asking for a high floor room and hopefully to be close, we ended up next door to each other which was perfect. We have rooms 602 603 perfect for bar, pool and sunbeds, couldnt of asked for better. Rooms are adequate and cleaned daily. It's a bit of a walk to the beach although a taxi back is advised. Staff work hard and are polite and humourous. Food is what you expect of a 3 star hotel and unless you're extremely fussy it's easy to find something. Drinks are great, not watered down rubbish. No complaints at all…

title: Holiday
review: Quite a traditional hotel. Had to pay for wifi outside of bar area. Rooms a little dated but were kept very clean. Not a lot of English holiday makers and entertainment was non existent. Free bus to beach and shops every day except Sunday. Jacuzzi was never on whole time as was there and kids were using it as a kids pool.

title: Not great
review: We stayed at this hotel for five days. On arrival the receptionist didn’t speak English very well and asked us “sprechen zee deutch “ the hotel was very clean and the staff were all friendly. However it would appear they the hotel caters mainly for Germans and all the brochures were in German even the Thomas cook ones who we booked with. My wife was told before we went that it was adults only but there were lots of children. The food was what you expect from most hotels and was average however the bar staff served drinks in plastic glasses which was no so good. There were sings stating that glaze must not be taken outside to the pool which is understandable, however if you were spending the evening in the bar proper glasses would have been better. We had to wait 2 hours on the…

title: Looks out of 1980 but a nice cheap stay
review: The hotel Perla was an average stay. Upon arrival at 2am my initial thoughts were worried as the hotel looks extremely old fashioned as if it hasn’t been redecorated for 40 years. However the room was clean and the bed comfy enough so happy to stay. Went all inclusive and cannot fault the food, especially as me and my partner are vegetarians we were weary but everything was delicious. The entertainment at the hotel is not worth bothering as the bar is tiny and about 2 people show up for their ‘DJ’ but there is a small pool and it’s nice to hang out in during the day when it gets too hot. There is a free bus from the hotel that goes into the centre of Puerto De La Cruz so no worries about the distance  and the times are relatively often too. Had a nice stay for what we paid.

title: Mrs Shepherd
review: Nice enough. Spacious rooms. Great staff. Food plentiful and well cooked. Roof terrace pool and bar is cool. Few silly little rules like No food in rooms from restaurant (we went all inclusive). There were no hot drink making facilities in rooms. The hotel is in need of a lick of paint. A modernising program needs to be pushed into here. New TVs needed in rooms, current ones are old and dated. Our room was directly under the restaurant, which we were woken at 4am every morning (not very happy about this!). Air con in rooms would be good. For the price we paid, its wasn't bad tho.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Another excellent holiday at this hotel. The staff were again great and even though the manager was on holiday the standard of service was amazing. Yanira organised the evenings for us and much fun was had. The bar staff as usual added to our pleasure. The rooms were their usual high standard and check in with David was super fast. Delilah’s smile always gives such a positive feel when in the dining room.  The only little gripe was the variety of food which didn’t seem quite as good as it has been, never the less my husband and I certainly didn’t go hungry so no real issues . Will we visit again? OF  COURSE WE WILL see you in October for visit number 7

title: Three week stay
review: Hotel Perla is a good Three Star. Clean, very friendly staff. The only drawback is the buffet food - very 'samey' and often cold. Shuttle bus into town very efficient. Would definitely go back.Rooms with a garden view preferable although the balcony there only gets the sun in the mornings. Easy walk to restaurants and bars.

title: Lovely Return
review: This is an hotel that we will no doubt visit again.It is not where an hotel should really be built but is seemingly not unusual in this part of the island. Access for the less able is not ideal unless you are prepared to use Taxis.There are free bus/coaches which run regularly (weekdays but not lunch time) but finish early- are not usually disabled friendly and in the afternoon is often not large enough and thus alternative arrangements may be made. Unlike some hotels the service does not run on Saturday afternoons or Sundays. In fact if wanting to go to the bus station or places in that area it is quicker to walk directly than to walk from where the service terminates. It takes about 20 minutes to walk down in a fairly obvious route to the nearest point of town or following the…

title: My holiday
review: We stayed here 10 years ago on our honeymoon and came back for our 10th Anniversary.   In that time the hotel has been improved but the main thing is the staff are still as friendly.   Good size room with a fridge but no kettle (we took our own).   Hairdryer was good but TV only had American news channel as the only English choice.   Never mind we bought a weeks internet for E10 and listened to our local radio on our tablet.   Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all buffet style with lots of choice and very tasty too.   Entertainment every night was OK and we joined in the dancing.   We hired a car at the airport.   We remembered our way to the hotel as it is not easy to find (download a roadmap or take a SatNav).   It is a 10 minute walk to the town and beach but it is a lovely…

review: Firstly the hotel, i think some of the reviews are a little unfair here, the hotel is a little shabby but its acceptable for 3 star,  similarly the food, canteen "school dinner" style and they clearly cater to a range of nationalities so the choice is not wide. People have also criticised the walk across the bridge into the hotel but its around a 5 minute walk, a little confusing to find your way into reception but nothing too bad  The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, its around a 20.minute walk into the town and beach bit well worth goimg a bit further to playa jardin which was lovely, taxis back qre around 5 euro, there is also a free bus but we could never seem to catch it for some reason so just ended up walking down/taxi back  So if you want a cheap break in a basic hotel…

We especially regret that your children have not had a pleasant experience, and we want to apologize for it. Thanks for your comments.

title: Better than we where led to believe
review: Sixth visit in 4 years. So happy to be back after a nightmare in Malta last year! Staff remembered me even after 2 years. That's what makes good service. Had a great holiday, met some lovely people. Service was,as always, excellent. From cleaning staff to management I couldn't have been made more welcome. Food was always well presented, never went hungry, room spotless, excellent courtesy bus service to town. Would not change anything. This is a 3star in 4star clothing. Not for everyone, but it suits me which is the important thing. Next year booked already 😎

title: Not the best.
review: On reading the past comments and looking at the one star ratings was not expecting a great deal from this hotel. How wrong we were.... it isnt a 5* hotel but then again it isnt 5* prices.   We found this hotel to be quirky, clean, friendly, everything you would expect from a 3* hotel. Food is delivered buffet style so never going to be piping hot and if you want that there is a microwave to heat it up in. The re isnt a wide range of choice at meal times but we found something nice all the time. Restaurant staff very friendly and we had our usual bottle of wine on our table before we got back with our soup. Reception staff very good as well, requested a taxi from them a couple of times and it wasnt a problem. Room cleaned every day, towels changed every other day.  Free bus down…

title: Excellent value for money
review: This was my third trip to this hotel this year and once again I'm sad to be going home. As others have pointed out it is very basic but what you do get is excellent value for money. I found all of the staff to be welcoming and friendly especially those who remembered me from my last visit. The food is not typically English but for me that's a plus when I go away as I like to try new things. If you're someone who likes to spend an entire holiday in your hotel, this place probably isn't for you but is a great base for a visit to the area. There's a free bus service apart from on Sunday and in any case local taxis are very cheap. I'd also recommend a visit to Loro Parque. I look forward to coming back next year at some point when I'm able to book some time off.

Balcony doors don't locked, in a quite area that sleeps at about 9 pm more like a retirement village...the list goes on and on. review: We came here for a relaxed holiday, we tried to be optimistic despite some reviews we read however we wish we listened!  Good points: the hotel is clean, most of the staff are lovely and welcoming, taxi is very cheap to get around or there is an option of a free bus!  Negatives: it’s out dated, the rooms are awful! The beds are hard, the tv barely works, the sockets are coming out of the walls, the overhead fan looks like it’s going to come off the ceiling every time we turn it on, some of the staff especially at night are quite rude! the food choices are limited and barely warm, we lived off chips and in the end ate out most of the time at a lovely restaurant in the centre close to the beach. This therefore made it a waste of the all inclusive option! the drinks served from the…

title: J Prades
review: Unfortunatily every day from 5 a.m. we are woken up because of very loud noises and music coming from the kitchen above our room  Friendly staf and the food is ok, but not everything is included in the all inclusive arrangement. After breakfast (7-10am), the bar opens for all-inclusive at 11am. Between those houres you can't even get a cup of coffee or glas of water. Strange  Rooms are clean and big but dated

title: Money went missing from our room
review: My wife and I visited Perla hotel between 24 July-2nd August. Our first impression was that the staff were helpful, and wanted to make our stay comfortable. By the end of the stay, we had a terrible and unacceptable experience, because we noticed that our holiday money was going missing from our room. First €20 went missing, and then at the end of our stay a further €100 note. We are sure that it went missing from our room, which was locked. We reported this through our travel agent,  and the police on our return to the UK, however the hotel did not respond to us. Because of this experience, and despite the rest of our visit being enjoyable, we would not recommend this hotel.

title: Poor and Dissapointing, Expected More
review: Dear guest. We have contacted the hotel reception, and there is no record of your complaint, and it is very rare, given that you assure that it has happened twice. If you wish, i invite you to contact us to clarify what happened. Friendly regards.

title: Week away from English snow
review: We stayed here for a week, all inclusive. As soon as we arrived there is a long walk down to the main reception. With suitcases this is not great as there is also a bridge to walk over as well. As the coaches/taxi cannot get to the main entrance you get dropped off at the back of the hotel. The reception is on the 5th floor. This was not sign posted when we arrived.   We paid for a double twin/standard. We expected at least 3 suitable beds as this was for 3 adults. The 2 single beds were okay but the 3rd chair/bed was terrible and gave myself terrible back pains. It was like a bed that was for the army! Forcing myself to use towels to suppress the bed springs from hurting my back.   The room itself was suitable for 2 people not 3, not much room. There are no drinking facilities…
