title: Fab holiday!!
review: Had a fab time at the perla tenerife. Was worried as had read all the negativity in reviews on here.  All the hotel staff were very warm and friendly reciprocated by the four of us...my husband, daughter (24) and son (17) and myslef. Food was good with lots of choice, even for the vegetarian in our group...again we had been worried about this due to reviews read, but really had no need to be. Rooms and hotel were kept very clean daily, towels and bed linen changed very regularly. Yes it was cloudy at times...That's the nature of the north of the island if you do your research you will know that. review: Service was good from start to finish especially Jorges the waiter although all the restaurant staff got to know us and acknowledged us every meal.  There was a good range of food available every meal time. Suited our palates! There are packed lunches available if you want to go out for the day. Cleanliness was brilliant. The evening entertainment was on a small scale but that suited us as we wanted a quiet holiday. In the evening we sat outside by…

review: We were two families staying there for a weekend. The service received from the Hotel Staff specially mentioning the service they gave since we were vegetarians and they took that extra effort to serve us vegetarian food out of the regular menu.  The hotel is at a quite location. You can be at peace inside the hotel, at the pool or at the solarium.  The Sauna was not working.  The things that need attention :  1. title: Very clean and overall had a good holiday
review: We have just returned from a 10 day family holiday here. Nice views but again with children could not use loungers whilst children splash around. Go to lago martianez in the day- fabulous for kids!…

title: This really isn't a bad hotel
review: We have just back from a weeks stay at La Perla. We had an enjoyable time and met some lovely people.  My son thoroughly enjoyed himself.  The rooms were big and clean.  The food could be better. More choice for people with allergies, i.e wheat. Also extend the all inclusive drinks for before 11 and maybe until midnight. An all inclusive band would be much better as we were asked for our pass all the time.  I recommend maybe they introduce some children's entertainment and more activities. Thanks a lot for a very memorable holiday.

title: Great 2 weeks holiday.
review: I have very little to complain about the staff are helpful and friendly the rooms are clean and pleasant and all made for a great holiday. If I had one complaint its that the wifi kept dropping out but didn't upset my holiday. I would recommend.

title: Basic, Pleasant but not for us again (as a family).
review: To be fair had a great 7 nights at the Perla with my friend.......heads up to Pablo and Francisco for putting up with us,they were brilliant.   As for the hotel its very clean rooms are cleaned daily which is very good, now to the food,to be fair it wasn't that bad I just prefer to go out for an evening meal but lunch will keep you going........I have travelled many different places and met many interesting people,but, Tenerife and the perla have been brilliant met some really good people and really did have a great time..........going back next year

review: TripAdvisor   We read a lot of reviews about this hotel just after booking.  Is it suited for families? We would say no.  However it wasn't as bad as we thought, the rooms are basic, cleaned daily and the staff do what they can to help, but we wouldn't stay again, here is why. title: Great company
review: Spent 10 days here at perla and had a great time! Met some fantastic people and a mix of languages! The staff are super friendly and are happy to get you whatever!  Yanira who does the entertainment is great and so lovely, and you'll never be bored! Quite impressed for saying its a 3 star hotel, nothing is ever too much bother!!!  Would recommend for a quiet break :)

title: Well worth the money - remember how cheap it is!!
review: Really enjoyed our stay here, the rooms were big and very clean and the food was very good compared to other three star all inclusives, they have a pool with a jacuzzi and sauna and a sun bed area, and lots of different drinks were available (but no cocktails) entertainment was okay but we were told that the hotel doesn't really get busy until August so there is probably a lot more to do then. The free bus service to the town is very useful, also really easy to get to the beaches and Loro parque. There is also quite a few shops and restaurants around. All the staff were really friendly and helpful, can't fault them. The only downside for us was that there is no air conditioning in the rooms, they have a fan but even with that on and the door open it was still too warm.

title: A pleasant off-peak break

title: My spring holiday
review: We visited the Hotel Perla at the end of June and were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews prior to our visit. However, that was soon put to rest on arrival.  Our flight had been delayed so by the time we arrived, the All Inclusive program had finished for the evening. We went to our room (which was basic but very clean and spacious!) and then popped to the bar where the barman (Diego) gave us some water to take to our room after we had bought a round of drinks.  The hotel is located in a very pretty residential area and as some of the reviews mention, has a predominantly Spanish clientele. However, we were not made to feel different or isolated because of this as some of the reviews suggest. I actually speak Spanish and can tell you that a little goes a long…

title: Try to avoid the place
review: There is only one plus of the place - nice and helpful stuff.  The food was plain and cheap. Remember, always look at the ketchup ;) If the management saves on ketchup, it will try to save on every other food products.  The carpet was dirty and stained. The furniture were dirty and wore out. I saw holes in blankets.  The hotel is in the middle of nowhere. You need to spend 5 EUR for taxi to get to the beach or walk 30 minutes.  The hotel was full of retired people. We were literally the only one couple with a kid.

title: Could not recommend
review: Dear guest. Thanks for your comments. We regret you had these inconveniences in our hotel, but let me inform you that we have a free shuttle bus wich drives mondays to fridays the way between the hotel and the shopping center "Martianez", wich is close to the beach and the sea water pools. And yes, we have many old people now, but this is a normal circumstance in these months. The rest of the year we have all type of clients, including young and middle age people. Thanks for our visit, and overall we hope you had a pleasant stay. Kind regards.

title: Overall very good
review: This is the first time I've written a bad review. Hotel staff are lovely but that is it. The first room they gave me was 2 doors down from the bar on 6th floor. I was moved to 5th floor then when I complained. Beds rock hard bad enough to hurt your back, the town is a very steep hike back to hotel, not what you feel like after going out to eat because food so bad at hotel (im not fussy at all but this food is bad and what you can eat is cold even after re-heating in microwave).  Beautiful place to visit but pick another hotel.

title: would not go back

Anyway, we thank you for your comments, and we gladly accept any suggestions to improve. Thank you for your visit and best regards.

title: Wouldn't recommend
review: Just got back from here today. It was a lovely stay. Hotel spotless and rooms cleaned everyday. Staff were friendly and knew most of the English language they can understand you well.  Pablo on the bar was brilliant very welcoming and could have a good laugh! but there was another member of bar staff that was miserable one in particular. Food wasn't great but it was as expected it's 3 star not 5 just remember. Breakfast lots of choice...lunch and tea mire Spanish style but they try to put English dishes on aswell. They get a lot of Spanish staying there so they have to cater for both I suppose. We got some good days of hot sunshine whilst we was there bit of rain though. It's a 15min walk to bottom of hill to beach shops and resturants. Plenty to do. There are excursions to go…

title: Honeymoon
review: Looking forward to staying from 25th April on our honeymoon mixed reviews but mostly good see you soon is there kettles in rooms were both very young at heart 61 and 58 so should suit us well .just hope it's hot then x

title: 4 star service for a 3 star Hotel
review: Dear guests. Thanks for choosing our hotel. At arrival you can ask for a kettle at recepction. They usually have, but it is upon availability. I hope you get a sunny holiday. These days have been a bit cloudy, but with a mild temperature ( betwenn 17 - 22 Cº during the day ). See you soon. Kind regards.

title: Deceiving Hotel
review: I stayed here for a week with two friends and I have to say it surpassed my expectations in some ways and in other its wasn't any less than the 3 star service you'd expect.  I wouldn't recommend it for younger groups as it was more for the senior type, however, we made a lot of friends there from all parts of Europe.  I also wouldn't recommend it for those with physical inabilities as the walk to and from the beach front was like an mountainous trek every time you walked it (and all up hill on the way back).  Due to flight complications we didn't arrive to the hotel until mid-night (as apposed to 8pm) and as we gave our names and received our All inclusive and room cards, the reception staff informed us that a plate of dinner was saved for us if we were hungry, which was an…

You get dropped off at a roundabout and need to walk up to the back entrance of the hotel over the bridge in the "jungle" as I liked to call it. We followed the signs to reception and then got stumped, luckily some people were passing by and told us to get in the lift and go to level 5 for reception. Check in was quick and easy. Safety deposit box is 30 euros in total but you get 15 back at the end. It's 10 euro for wifi for a week, very hit and miss if desperate get it if not do without. The room was clean, and basic, we had clean bedding, got spare pillows out as one does not seem enough, a little…

title: Better than expected
review: We've just got back from here and had a lovely time. We had read very mixed reviews so were unsure what to expect. However the staff were great particular mention going to Kruger, Darwin and celia who were excellent. Always smiling and happy to help. Yes the cockerels were a bit noisy but didn't really bother us. The pool was warm but sadly the Jacuzzi was 'kaput' so they said! The food was fine and the drinks were fine.

title: interesting
review: The hotel was generally clean and the staff were helpful and friendly. There was a small swimming pool under cover which kept it a bit warmer and a very nice sunbathing area with views over the town and of mount teide However, the beds were rock hard , the dining hall was a little too small and the food was always luke warm or cold. The lift felt a little unsafe, although we never had any problems. The location was good in some ways and bad in others. It was very quiet as it was away from the main town but without a car there was very little to do because it was away from the town. The hotel seemed to be geared for German tourists and there were a large number of German pensioners staying who seemed to all now each other so it was difficult to get to know anyone but maybe this…

review: Positives: Friendly staff, nice sunbathing area, generally clean, very quiet, 10 minute drive to Puerto De La Cruz, large space for clothes. Building: Lifts are interesting (very old, cranky), dining hall is too small, no heating, swimming pool is too small, sauna was not working, wifi not working, no signs to hotel so had to get a taxi to instruct us where to go, must have a car to get around as in the middle of nowhere. Rooms: Beds are extremely hard and uncomfortable, shower has no power, bath is the size for a child, handles on doors aren't straight, balcony shows a wall with no view what so ever, patio doors don't lock, the ''duvet'' was like a curtain, pillows are long, flat cushions which are uncomfortable, pillow cases weren't cleaned, just turned over. Paid WiFi available only in reception area due to poor signal. In conclusion - our stay was good but we will definitely not come back to this hotel.

title: Really enjoyed our fist time at the Perla
review: Although basic, the hotel is set in beautiful grounds with just a 15min walk to the beach. The hotel is exceptionally clean and the staff were very friendly. This might have been enhanced because we made an effort to communicate wherever possible in their language. They genuinely appreciated that. I'd definitely stay here again, in fact I'm already looking into re-booking. If you like beautiful landscapes, scenery, architecture and people - the quiet life - choose here. If you want to party, head south.

title: Holiday last min due to sharm cancelling
review: Christmas and New Year holiday with my wife now our 9th time in Puerto de la Cruz but the first at the Perla. It is a good distance from the centre of town but not too far. We walked down and back (sometimes again after dinner) almost every day and I'm not the fittest. The quiet area and location beside a barranco away from main roads and crowds suited us perfectly. The cockerels in the barranco are noisy and can start as early as 4am but after a couple of days we were used to them and now were back home we miss hearing them!  Very friendly and helpful staff made us very welcome. Our room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel. The small fridge in the room was useful. Really great shower and the beds were very comfortable.  We were all inclusive but only took breakfast and…

title: Ok hotel bad rooms 101 to 104
review: Hotel ok. Very difficult to find in residential area in a one way system. 10 mim walk down hill to a few bars which were closed sat and sun. Foods fine generally able to find something. Rooms large and clean. Our wardrobe did smell fusty so couldn't hand clothes in it. We didn't have a fridge or any chairs in room, the room chairs had been moved to the terrace. Not good having fabric chairs outside when it rains. Do not stay in rooms 101 to 104 these rooms are at the front of the hotel and there is a 30ft high stone wall 10ft from the patio door making the rooms permanently dark. All inc for drinks runs out at 12pm on the day of departure which they didn't tell us about.

On the beach, or you can go shuttle bus. hotel in comparison to the price / quality is welcomed.
