title: Average/good depends what you paid!
review: Was a little out of the way and certainly nothing like the photos. The only good thing was the cleanliness, it was spotlessly clean, This is the reason I have rated as average. Lack of Air-con can make it a bit stuffy in the rooms. Food was ok, quite basic, breakfast & desserts were very repetitive All-inclusive was a bit of a waste for us as we spent most of the time in town where the food and drink is very cheap and much better than what is on offer in the hotel. 99% of the staff are very helpful and friendly, this is let down by 1 grumpy barman who never smiled or spoke during the time we were there. Everything seemed to be a chore for him and he certainly wasn't meant to be in the 'entertainment' business. Beware of the 11pm finish for all-inclusive. We were in the queue…

title: Quiet holiday
review: The hotel perla Tenerife was a little of the beaten track but really friendly place but mostly Spanish who were really nice just couldn't understand them .we went all-inclusive some of the food was Spanish but there was something for everyone to eat the pool area and the bar and bar staff were funny and helpful .not far from the town which was really good for food or get a coffee and do some people watching would go again even thou me and my friends were younger   .

title: tig and freda
review: Just had a month over easter and it was brilliant. Hotel was very clean, towels changed every day and sheets changed every 3 days. Staff were friendly and very effiecent.As long as you don,t mind walking the scenery is breath taking, well worth the the money.2 down points no dark rum and no HP sauce apart from that one of the best holidays wev,e had.

title: Don't pay for all-inclusive don't go there at all
review: Worst all-inclusive experience in my life  Awful place. .. Not worth money I have paid .. Only staff there is kind and helpful  Restaurant and room service doing great job  Guest age 60+ Drama drama drama

title: Don't go there worst hotel posible
review: I would not recomend this hotel, not even to my enemies.We went there for easter this year and picked the hotel because of ''kids club'' facilities advertised.:         - No kids facilities whatsoever in fact the place is a focal point for very old age pensioners from Spain France and Austria          - we got coned by cheap all inclusive deal but if you want a coffee at 10 Am tough luck couse restaurant is closed and bar openes at 11 am. If you dare go back in the breakfast area you get cautioned. and most off all very bad food. All breakfast meaty products are so bad you can smell the plastic inside from a mile. All the alcoholic drinks you ever heard off you have to pay as included in all inclusive was only cheap no name (e.g. i couldn't finish one pint of beer). Coffee was…

title: A really nice place
review: After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive about this hotel, but they were all dispersed on arrival. The staff were helpful, pleasant and friendly. The room was bigger than expected, was very clean and comfortable - cleaned every day. The Hotel sits North to South so one side gets the sun in the morning the other in the afternoon, so you get the sun in your room for half the day. The rooms all have a small fridge but no kettle (we took a travel kettle, which for Brits' is essential!!). A good sized bathroom. The hotel is in a quiet location out of town, but there is a shuttle bus every hour (not Saturday pm or all day Sunday). We enjoyed the walk into the town (about 25 mins down hill) coming back is uphill so unless you want the extra exercise is something…

title: Nice friendly clean hotel
review: Just had 10 nights at the Perla and it was an enjoyable stay.  The staff are friendly and helpful (which they weren't in the last hotel I stayed in at this resort) and the buffet food generally good (desserts could be better but there's plenty of ice cream!).  The room was cleaned daily and the maid set up the clean towels in the shape of two swans on the bed most days, a nice touch.  It felt like the staff enjoyed their work and wanted us to have a nice stay.  We had a second floor room overlooking a ravine where the dreaded cockerels roam.  These caused us no bother at all, in the event, but the one noise-related thing I would comment on is that the walls / floors / ceilings are paper-thin so you might want to take some earplugs!  Thankfully most of the clientele are of a…

title: dont go two weeks before christmas
review: first of all you couldn't fault the cleanliness, the rooms are average but do have bath and shower although bath very small ,no one spoke much English and this was the Spanish and German holiday time so music was all foreign I didn't mind that as I was in Spain. alcohol was very cheap and wine not drinkable, the pool was freezing and the Jacuzzi  the food was just ok for a cheap break  ,although no one told us there was a tv lounge we found out off people on the way home apart from us no one in the hotel was under 65 and that's being kind but all in all staff did try and help and cleaners could be more kind

title: Great Value, over-delivers vs price and star rating.
review: Being a Regional Sales Manager for 4 globally branded boutique style hotels in London,  I was pleasantly surprised how this halfway-up-the-hill  hotel  offers a great deal  and excellent value for money.  It's best features : The staff << could not do enough to make me feel at home and welcome, even the housekeeping staff were friendly and greeted, and the restaurant and bar staff were always there and knew after a day whet I liked and wanted.   The food is plenty and varied, on the departure date the continental side was ready at 530am to allow us a breakfast before departing early.  The food qualty is good for a 3 star hotel, the evening with local cuisine and Rabbit dishes was really nice and tasty.  The all inclusive element meant a reasonable selection of deinks including…

title: tig and freda.
review: Have been here a few years ago and it was very good, it was clean, tidy, friendly and the food was axcelent. The only fault i could find was they did not do dark rum (ron negro) which is rhe same price as other cheap spirits.I have booked again for march for a month so having dark rum will make the holiday perfect.

title: Shoot the cockerels and sack the dj.
review: All inclusive stay three rooms, family stay over new year.  Breakfast excellent, lunch ok and dinner usually very varied.  However. You may only have beer, tap water or unmarked (awful) wine by the bottle in the restaurant. You may NOT EVEN TAKE A COFFEE out of the restaurant!  Only CERTAIN DRINKS ARE ALL INCLUSIVE. Coffee included, cappuccino you pay! Tiny pots of cheap ice cream included, ice lollies etc you pay! Cakes at 4pm in the bar, these are the Danish pastries left from breakfast covered in a tea towel on the bar. Do not expect afternoon tea! The pool area is great but the sunbathing is on a different level so you can't relax and let the children swim. But the lifeguard is there.  THE DJ. SERIOUSLY NEEDS SACKING!!!!! 7 nights full bar and no one on the dance floor!…

title: Value for money 3Star in lovely Porta de la Cruz.
review: Ten Day all inclusive christmas break. The hotel has undergone a refurb and was clean and tidy.Rooms cleaned daily. Midsize hotel,arrived on my birthday to a bottle of champagne and basket of fruit, and a fourth floor reception side room with full ensuite,with bidet. The food was diverse,bar was on the 6th floor adjacent to a small pool,setting perfect for older discerning couples.....Cakes served in bar at 4.00pm....Sunroom with small book exchange. Fantastic sun terrace above.Weather was perfect,all sunshine....with a fantastic view of Mount Tiede...snow glistening on the upper slopes. Porta de la Cruz a lush well laid out town,the spanish use it as one of their favourite resorts. My other half,would go back for second helpings....... The town is modern and plenty of shops and…

title: PLEASANTLY SURPRISED
review: My sister and I spent a week at the Perla and were not disappointed. Food was lovely, house wine very reasonable at 5 euro a bottle/2 euro a glass so we did not feel ripped off as we have on occasion at other places. Our room was clean and spacious. It is not in the town centre but we sometimes got the free bus into town or walked. I would recommend this to couples and groups but not for families. The town PDLC has something for everyone but we loved to get on a bus and discover the little villages in the surrounding area. It can be great fun as we had to attempt to speak spanish or mime. The Botanical Gardens is near to the Hotel which is worth a visit. A good selection of shops quite near too. This Hotel is not recommended for anyone with mobility problems but we were…

title: very enjoyable holiday
review: Just returned from 10 day holiday at Perla. The hotel was just as we expected, did not disappoint. It is, in my opinion a 3 star budget hotel with a good reputation. I The staff are pleasant and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean, with linen changed regularly. We stayed all inclusive and found this to be good value, the alcohol and mixers were of a good standard, no complaints at all. The food was plentiful, slightly limited but there was always something to suit everyone. At lunch and dinner we were given a bottle of wine. There was beer , water , juices on tap. Egg and bacon at breakfast was well received. Lots of fruit, veg and salad. Deserts were a bit unimaginative.         The hotel is favoured by the Spanish, and we enjoyed a few evenings watching guests who were…

title: Honey moon
review: The rooms are very much basic but depending on where your room is the hotel offers lovely views.  The rooms are kept clean every day. The food is pretty much the same everyday except for dinner they may have rabbit, shark or octopus on. At dinner and tea you get offered a bottle of wine or beer if your all inclusive which is nice. The staff at meal times are very welcoming and helpful. The bar doesn't open till 11 if you're all inclusive and you after pay extra for cocktails and other drinks which is a shame.  The bar holds the entertainment on a night at 9 pm let me stress this isn't for young people at all the entertainment carters for the oaps. Outside the bar there is the pool area which is very deep with some lovely views, on the roof they are sun beds to sunbathe again…

title: Lovely
review: Stayed for 7 nights in march, no complaints about the hotel, food or staff. Hotel was clean and maid service everyday. Food was hot and there was always something for everyone. Staff was always friendly and willing to assist. There was entertainment nightly including bingo, disco and live music. Hotel is situated a good walk away from town but they do put on a free bus to and from. This hotel is more suitable for older couples/groups, we went away for a break and some sun and that is exactly what we got. Would I go back yes deffo. Loro Parque is a must.

title: Birthday Treat
review: ROOMS  Spotlessly clean for our whole stay but just a little basic.  FOOD  Food option were really good a varied.  BAR  Was all inclusive so prices i'm not sure about  Overall is was a really good place to stay and the service was spot on.  I was asked if i would go back and without a doubt i would.  20 minutes walk from the town but a free bus service MON to FRI and SAT morning are provided.  The cleanliness of the hotel was great.

title: Very Spanish - good clean accommodation
review: The hotel is situated around 20  minutes walk (set in the hill) from the beach/centre. Good points: hotel very clean, staff pleasant, good budget accommodation, food was ok, bar area nice, pool area well maintained, plenty of sunbeds on roof terrace. Primarily caters for Spanish customers.  Bad points: unsuitable location for those with mobilty problems, the hotel is set a good 20 min downhill walk to the beach area (which means uphill return!), the pool area is on the 6th floor, sun terrace is on the 7th floor and reception is on 5th floor. there are 2 lifts, but we took the stairs (many!) if you have a room on the ground floor there is a constant thoroughfare of suitcases and other guests coming and going. The clientele were generally elderly people. There is no childrens pool.

title: Typically Spanish - a breath of fresh air
review: I am not going to repeat what other, better, writers have written.  The Hotel Perla is off the beaten track and is a realistic 15 minutes DOWN to the town in Puerto.  The whole of Puerto de la Cruz is hilly.  You are either walking up or down, don't go if this is an issue for you, head to the Southern resorts.  There is a regular free bus from the hotel and back throughout the day all day from Monday to Friday and Saturday morning.  The slog back up the hill (and the several stairs involved) are good for the thigh muscles!  The Perla is authentic to what it is - a 3 star hotel in Tenerife (the key is it is in Tenerife, not Skegness or Bournemouth).  The entertainment is Spanish (eventually the disco does include some English songs but not until the last half an hour or so), and…

title: Off the beaten track
review: A quiet hotel, a good 20 minute walk from the promenade. All inclusive package was good value for money. Breakfast either hot or cold, plenty of choice. Cereals, yogurt, bread/toast all freely available and always topped up. Lunch and dinner were casual, again, plenty to choose from. Spanish food predominant but always chips/fries and new potatoes. Wine/beer offered with each meal, Water was always available. Entertainment is for the more elderly, but dancing is encouraged. Rooftop pool and sun loungers are both fine! Staff are friendly and approachable.

title: Good for a 3 Star Hotel
review: This hotel is built on the side of a Barranco (valley).  This means that the first three floors and part of the 4th are below street level and therefore rooms on the street side of the hotel have very limited views (usually a wall).  Bearing in mind the amount of time you spend in your hotel room (apart from sleeping), to many this is not a problem.  The other side of the hotel looks across the Barranco. Because of this construction, reception is on the 5th floor (level with the road).  Some Agents however drop their clients in the housing estate on the other side of the Barranco which involves a walk across a bridge to the hotel (100 metres) and leaves you on the ground floor searching for reception.  The hotel is clean and the rooms are cleaned daily to a good standard. It is…

title: A verry good all inclusive hotel
review: We had the pleasure staying in Le Perla this Christmas and new years holiday. The food was good, rooms clean,people friendly. Everything worked very well. When we decided to stay at the Le Perla we were conserned about some of the rather bad reviews . But it showed out that these people must have been staying in another hotel. We recomend this hotel.

title: Great holiday!!
review: Myself and my partner stayed in this hotel October 2013 for 1 week. We have 4 kids between us so the lack of children (on our child free holiday) was fantastic!! It isn't suitable for kids as others have commented................but I would take the time to find that out before i booked so who is actually at fault?? I found the staff pleasant enough, English not fab but its not England. Hotel was clean and tidy. Rooms had new towels and were cleaned to a very good standard every day. Yes the Hotel was a little run down, not smack next to the beach etc but it charges budget prices, what do people expect these days? Want 5 star?? Pay 5 star prices. Food was lovely, yes a little repetitive but lovely all the same and I managed to have something different every day. We really…

title: Lovely Hotel, everything you want for 3 Start!!
review: Some of the reviews for La Perla are ridiculous, I mean it is a 3 start hotel and some people want 5 star.  Me and my boyfriend have just come back from a lovely weeks stay, we paid £299 for 1 weeks all inclusive (hotel, flights and transfer) and I can say I was dissapointed.    The staff were very friendly, hotel is very clean the maids are in every day there is no mess around the pool or sunbathing area.  As for the moody/angry barman everyone goes on about you must have been rude to him as we had no bother had a good laugh with him and he was very helpful.  Yes there wasn't many english in the hotel, but for me that was nice, if I wanted to holiday with english I would stay in england!!  The restaurant was lovely, and at first I was worried being all inclusive incase I didn't…

title: good value hotel
review: this was a last minute booking and i was a little concerned by some of the reviews! however on arrival all i can say is what a lovely friendly hotel this is. The food was delicious although some may say not alot of choice but there was definately something different to try each night. The waiters were friendly and the walk to the beach and town is lovely. This is a place i would stay in again.

title: Pleasant short stay
review: This hotels is small, very clean and very Spanish orientated. I went with my wife for a 4day break and we enjoyed our stay arriving on 22nd nov.  the hotel is situated on a hill, the whole area is hilly, but didn't bother us at all was a 15 minute walk down to the centre and beach, which is a lovely area with lots of restaurants and shops, instead of the steep walk back up to the perla hotel we got taxis which general costed between €3-5. After reading a lot of reviews about noise, eg cockerels we never heard a thing!  The hotel rooms are clean and spacious, the restaurant small sometimes at breakfast there's a short wait for a table but not a problem, the food was excellent although not much choice what were out we really enjoyed, the staff in the restaurant speak very little…

title: Improvement required
review: We visited this hotel for an all inclusive holiday for one week.  We arrived at night ourselves via a hire car so we could get around the attractions and sites of the island.  The hotel did have reasonable and clean rooms, which were cleaned each day to a high standard.  The staff were very helpful in the bar and on reception, especially the barman with the glasses. Now for some constructive feedback, the entertainment was aimed at Spanish holiday makers, German, English, Polish and other nationalities were ignored which was very poor considering the hotel is trying to gain more trade during low season.  The meals were monotonous and there was not much change or variety which considering the food on offer there could be improved with an inspired chef.  The policy of putting…

title: So Lucky it was Shut
review: We booked into this hotel from Aug 24th to the 30th and we got a call from our agent to say that unfortunately the dates that we had booked were no longer available and the hotel was shut. We usually go four star with a gym and all inclusive but we thought we would go cheap and if it was no good we would eat out, and walk a lot as we read reviews which said it was on a hill. We were told they could move us to another hotel which was a four star near to the beach with no extra cost we looked at the hotel and thought this looks a lot better and would have been nearly double the price so we took them up on their offer. The hotel was The Gran Hotel Turquesa Playa if you want to read my review later. When we were on holiday we kept thinking about what the other hotel was like and why…

title: noisy hotel
review: great little hotel, me and my girlfriend met some great people there, the bar man was a un happy bloke, the staff were excellent, the food was great, only prob really was the noise, if not the bloody cockrell, the people leaving for home in the early hours of the morning shouting and dragging there wheely bags over the tiled floor, you can imagine,ok its a bit of a walk to the beach, but I like walking , you get to see other places you might miss. I would go again... it was November 2011 when we went

title: perla hotel tenerife
review: we just recently back from staying in perla , was a lovely hotel clean and friendly . my only fault is the food it were hit and miss but plenlty full . there are a few cockrels around as others have stated but they not that loud . the hotel is not good for familes with small children as there no animation tea or facilities for them . you get clean towels and bedding everyday rooms are dated but very clean all in all we enjoyed our stay and would go back if wanting a quiet holiday again .

title: Winter Sun
review: Got a shock when dropped off at the back and directed to Reception on the 5th floor arriving at the 5th We were on street level because hotel is built into the cliffside, food superb staff friendly, rooms large and airy, its quite a way up the hill but 4 euros in a taxi cures that prob. Town itself is lovely with lots to do if it takes your fancy

title: Natural life surround
review: Bad is tuff and sunbads are old not comfortable. Pool is very small and bit far from centre, high hill to walk back to hotel. Bartender xavier is the best and funny. Plenty 60ts 70ts songs playing in the bar,and 90/ costumers very old. Overall if you like natural life plenty chickens, goats, birds and lizards around the hotel.

title: Review March 2013
review: Hotel is average, generally clean but a bit dated. Rooms are adequate but again need a face lift, very small TV in room and bathrooms look tired Beds are not great, mattress need replacing  Food in restaurant very bland and poor quality, not much variety, but plenty of it  Pool area pleasant enough, Overall for approx £25 pppn quite good value   I would give the Perle Tenerife overall 7/10

title: perla hotel
review: we booked this holiday all inclusive at short notice. overall it was value for money. the food was average, most of the staff were very good for service. there is one guy on reception who was just an ignorant pig. the hotel is on a hill, if you cant walk far or have a problem with walking this is not for you. tenerife is full of hills and slopes

title: Amazing
review: I will remember these holidays till the rest of my life. All the staff was fab, very warm and helpful people! Food was nice as well, nice local wine, good entertainment, bit to short, only couple hours! Bar man which you all taking about is very nice. They treat you the way you treat them. Will be back for sure.

title: holiday on hill
review: The hotel has a good position, quiet area, high above the hospital, and is located on a hill. We used the car and we not went to town on foot once. There is a mini bus that goes to a hotel to city but we did not use it. We took the car right at the airport, Orcar car, and we were pleased. We returned the car at the airport so we had all the time available. In front of the hotel is always place for parking on both sides of the street, and there were no problems and everything is free because this is place for  private villas and no traffic policeman. It's a lot easier for us where we fit car at night. Reception is open 24 hours, they're really friendly and willing to help with advice, but be sure to ask about everything you've heard and what do you plan to visit. Then they will…

title: Great hotel!
review: We loved this hotel. It is family run and has a happy atmosphere. Our room was very large, clean and comfortable, with a good sized bed, bathroom, fridge, balcony over the garden. The pool and sunbathing area were quiet and very accessible, with views on Teide on one side and the town and sea on the other. It's in a residential area above the town and cleverly planned not to spoil the landscape. The restaurant is very good, the food ample and varied. We'll be going back!

title: NEVER AGAIN
review: well what can we say  apart from dont waste your money on this hotel  not near the beach  not good for families with children  food poor  entertainment very poor  staff very rude  the pics are not  any think you like what it is  no mini bar  no coffee and tea in rooms  no air con no kids pool  no sauna  no second bar or second pool  and the tv room what a joke  and what every you do if you do book ask for a room at the front of the hotel not the back otherwise you will be awake most of the night from 2 am with cockerels  the rudest bar staff   ai stops at 11 pm and the bar closes by 11.45 every night sharp  we can g on and on   we have loads of pics but only putting a few on here just showing a few things  it took them 7 days to fix the socket and 10 days to move rooms  just be…

title: fat  chips  golden  girls
review: we   arrived  3  twirlies   Oct  15  th  to  29th  Had  a  fantastic 2 weeks .We  are  nice  to all the  staff  and  they could  not  do  enough ,If  you  asked  for  any thing  it was  there  Even  make  a little  effort with  the spanish .THEY  LIKE  THAT  .These  people  who  complain  i cannot  understand .Yes  they  eat  a lot  of  fish  that  is  what  they  do .The  salads  where  lovely  if  you  ate nothing  else  No  its  not  for  children unless they  can  amuse themselves . and  not  spoilt  brats  i Met  2  lovely  boys  and  a  girl  .every  day  they  did  a  family  adventure ;We  loved  having  some  lovely  youn  people .So  enjoyed  theire  company .Made a  great  change  from   oldies  fighting   after   the   hp  sauce  Yes  do  not  go  there  with  a …

title: a holiday is what you make it!
review: My fiance and I have no complaints about the hotel whatsoever! Our room was very clean and tidy. The food was very good and you always find something for yourself! we didnt really have any complaints about the food at all!! All staff was very friendly, all barmans were having a laugh with us every day! even the fat one (well he wasnt fat at all, big ish but not fat) was pleasant and happy so I dont know what people are on about.If u r nice to them they will return nice behaviour!  The cockrels are not that noisy what people say!! we could barely hear them! we even were feeding cute little things :) Entertainment was good, especially Dj who played every other night! . There is a free bus to town but we never used it because it was a nice walk and we had a chance to burn some…

title: try for yourself
review: saw many mixed reviews,and im glad i went,would defo go back.its high up in the mountains,the views are amazing,quite a trek back up,but there is a free bus or the taxi is about £3.50.im a fussy veggie,and i stuffed myself continually!!, the place is clean and tidy,nothing fancy,but not there much anyway,the room had a washing machine!! fridge and radio,balcony quite small,staff are friendly and helpful,the evening bar man was brillant!!.entertainment had 3 nights of a disco good choice of music,1 night a man singing and playing piano,good but not my thing,a animal night,one night without and didtnt see the other. night.yes there are cockrails and hens and there babies and i loved them!! and fed them,its apart of spain.puerto del la cruz is a great place to visit,beach is…

title: Great Value
review: IHad a great time at this hotel. And for the price think it’s a bargain. Food variety was limited but quality was good. Hotel was clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Walk to town is not as bad as people make out. But it is a steep climb back. I walked most days and on a night were beers made that difficult got a taxi, which was very cheap (less than 5 euro)

title: Hotel in a nutshell
review: The hotel was like retirement home, the food was fish every day so we had to eat out even though we were all inclusive.The pool is freezing steps are slippy and coming away from the side also the jaquzzi does not work and you have to pay 10 euros for the sauna. The barman that everyone complains about is a miserable rude and strict member of staff and wont let you have more then one drink at a time and even told off a child for having ice cream. All inclusive does not start until 11am (not even a glass of water to take my tablets) before that you have to pay and it finishes at 11pm. If you have a late flight home your gonna be starving and thirsty as all inclusive is stopped at 12am when you check out your room leaving you for hours on your last day with nothing to eat and drink…

title: Enjoyable
review: Myself and my partner and my 7 yrs old daughter were there last week for a week,  on arrival we were very late 10.30pm,  and the staff had kept us a salad back for our tea which i thought was really good of them,  the hotel we found was clean and tidy,  there was always hot water .  The food was good was always plenty of choice and something for everyone,  the staff apart from one fat barman i could not complain about,  (the fat barman is a horror and should not be in the hotel businesss,  as he is very rude and argumentative)  the roosters well yes they do go on but you get use to it.  My only problem was they did not have a childrens pool as i found the pool very deep for my 7 yr old,  overall i would go back as staff were friendly and helpful,  food was good,  the maids were…

title: Beware the fat barman!!!
review: My husband and I have just finished our 2wk A.Inc break at this hotel,The hotel was pretty basic but the staff were very friendly,hotel and rooms very clean,not an awful lot of choice in menu tho,also you couldnt get a drink outside the breakfast room before 11a.m thats when the poolbar opened,even for a cuppa or water,the bar closed too early too,11pm..or 12pm if you paid.There were 3 bar staff,2 were lovely guys but the fat one was a little Hitler,his manner to almost everyone stank,you would dread his shift.(no need for it manners cost nothing)should,nt be in the job with his attitude..there was a free bus to town but stopped too early,not too much of a prob as taxis were cheap,around 3-4eur but if ordered from hotel rec it would double!!The town was very pretty but too hilly…

title: Lovely weekend
review: Me and my daughter have just spent a long weekend here. It was lovely, all the staff were friendly. The reception staff were always polite and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. It was a bit out the way but the hotel run a regular shuttle bus down to the town. It's ideal if you want a quite lazy holiday. The only thing I would say was annoying are the roosters, but they do'nt go all day. All in all it was a enjoyable weekend.

title: had a very relaxing holiday
review: i was dreading going to this hotel when reading reviews but once i was there thought it was good , our room was very clean and the maids were excellent. the food was good you coud always find some think to eat. pool was great . yes two bar staff were not very happy and but i didnt let that spoil the holiday. there was a free bus that took u into the town that ran all day but the walk was ok as well. the only thing that i didnt like was not much entertainment at night and the cockrels were noisy.

title: The worst hotel we have ever been to
review: Bar staff and reception staff rude and not pleasant. Fat guy in the morning at the bar was the worst. he shouldn't work with people at all. We never saw him smiling. On last day told us we have to pay for drinks when we had all inclusive. Stupid rules about not getting drinks before 11am. Roosters were horrible, waking you up at 4am. Restaurant staff was very nice. Food was horrible, no choice and everything smells the same. Loads of cockroaches outside. It was 5 of us in twenties, there was no one else in our age. only old people. We wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

title: i had a lovely holiday :)
review: after booking my holiday, i came on here to read some reviews and was a bit upset and thought - what have we done!! im 26 and my partner is 31 so we were on a holiday to relax and just enjoy ourselves. In terms of the hotel its self - i liked it, our room was very clean and the maid came in everyday to make the beds and change the towels ect - we never encountered any maids and were in the room at different points during the day which was good.. the staff didnt seem to speak alot of English but i didnt find this much of a problem and were all friendly enough.. i had to see a doctor over there and the man in reception was very helpful and called the doctor to come and he came to our room to help, if it wasnt for the man in reception we would have been stuck!! the drink was good -…

title: Was nearly put off reading reviews, wish we listened
review: They do not show you the hotel is surrounded by a 100m gully, full of roosters that will wake you up at 6am if the noisy cleaners don´t do it before.  We were all inclusive, and in our mid twenties, and the food wasn´t great and not up to standards although breaksfast was perfect daily as full english served.  Hotel is clean but very dated.  All in all if you like peace and quiet, then don´t come here.  Not recommended!!! The pictures you will see don´t give the full idea of what the resort is like and what surrounds it.  The only good thing was when requested we were given a kettle.  We would strongly advise people not to stay here, as we didnt listen to the reviews and are now regretting coming to this resort.

title: Mike from London the Man threatened with the pool cue
review: This certainly isn't the best 'all inclusive' place to stay.  The pictures the Thomas Cook rep showed me must have been taken with one of those magic cameras.  The hotel needs refurbishing top to bottom. Pool area dangerous for kids, no shallow end. The hotel is high up the hill and there is no safety railings to stop anyone falling over the edge.  Our room was old fashioned but the maid was friendly and cleaned it every day.  The beds! well where do I begin? you sat on the end and they tipped up, the springs dug in you they were right passion killers.  Food was real rubbish same most days leftovers used up that evening or next day very limited choice.  The crockery was chipped and cracked.  The staff in the restaurant were pleasent. If they ran out of vodka at 9pm then you had…

title: DO NOT GO OR... WASTE YOUR MONEY
review: Me and my husband are actually here right now and felt the need to warn people off coming here, we still have 4 nights left from our 10 night stay and we are discusted. The staff are completely rude and moody, its the bar and reception staff, they go mad at you in spanish then ask normally whats wrong in english and NEVER EVER smile or say thankyou or hello. No aircon in rooms, just a ceiling fan which isnt at all that good it just blows hot air around the room, the rooms are dirty, urine on bathroom floor from previous occupants. The food is just, well.. terrible! I am 28 weeks pregnant, so as you can imagine i have to watch what i eat for obvious reasons and they do not label any of the food bar from maybe one dish.. its highly repeatative and is always ùse ups from previous…

title: dont treat this as an all inclusive resort
review: as an hotel its average,  no aircon apparantly in any of the rooms however the fan was sufficient for me.  quite a poor location,  to far up the hill. its a pleasant walk into town but but quite an uphill hike back!  the only pool is small with no sun loungers,  just half a dozen plastic tables with chairs.  the food average but felt cafeteria ish.    the bar closes at 11.00pm and the beer is served in little plastic cups,  the type you get at kids partys.     puerto de la cruz is a very picturesque resort,  very relaxing atmosphere,  the staff in the hotel were pleasant i just wish i hadn,t booked all inclusive

title: best 10 days of my life!
review: i went with my friend and were we a bit worried about going when we read some of the reviews! but we were pleasantly suprised! our room was perfect size with a balcony also a good size, the only bad thing that the pillows were a bit crap & there will loads of cockerels out side our room, but you get used to that, and made it fun by cockodoodledoodling back :) breakfast was superb! very tasty.. lunch and dinner would variey.. some days good, some days bad.. the fish was the best part very fresh and the salad was very fresh including the fruit. drinks were good, but they could have more of a variety on the spirits. and you couldn't get drinks until 11. so if you are like me, an early riser, i advise you stock your fridge up the night before. in other reviews people complain that…

title: Beter Than Expected!
review: After reading the reviews of this hotel i was rather worried about what we would be greeted with on arival to the hotel! i have to say that within 30 mins of arriving i had totally settled down, the first thing we noticed was how clean the hotel was, secondly the reception staff were very nice and assured us that someone would be on reception 24hours if we had any problems! This was reassuring.   We got our room key and found our room on the 1st floor, it was massive, very clean and had everything we needed. Once we were unpacked we found our way to the bar and being all inclusive were expecting the drinks to be small/watered down which is what other reviews have suggested. We found the complete opposite, drinks were great, tho very strong as they dont measure the ammount of…

title: 3* who you kidding!
review: I am aware of the saying ‘’You get what you pay for’’! Well I don’t think we even got that! This must have been one of the worst holidays we have had in years. If it was not for the great people who were sharing our hell I think we would have packed and left. The place it’s self was clean and some of the staff were obliging but apart from that it has nothing and I repeat nothing going for it. Do not spend your hard earned cash going here as you will be so disappointed. The pictures that you see must have been taken in the 80’s as it does not reflect what it looks like now. They Spanish staying there are allowed to do whatever they like and they get first preference even if the barman is halfway through serving you he stops to serve them. One threatened an English guy with a…

title: Would never come back here
review: Well for a start they lie throughout the write up of what's in the hotel, it has a outdoor swimming pool that's it! The spanish food was terrible! If u like english food then your getting chips and bread rolls. All inclusive but you don't even get a drink of your choice its selective drinks only and the spirits are there own brands, the vodka made me ill so couldn't even drink there. So I may aswell have not been all inclusive as I was eating and drinking out so cost more anyway! They have a 12 o clock at night curfew (go to your room or we call police) or go out to the small town which has about 2 nightclubs! When you get home you'll be hearing cockrels squealing in your sleep! The entertainment was electrifying and by that I mean shocking and some nights no entertainment! The…

title: oh my days!!!!!
review: oh my days, this place is a disgrace. the bar man hits on u, the receptionist tells you off for talking etc after 00.00 the food is awful i.e squuid, boney fish, turkey that was grey not white. most of the utilities didnt work, the jacuzzi, sauna, bbq, there is no supermarket at the hotel although it says there is. to be fair this hotel was more like a hostel than a hotel. ate out more times or lived of chips but even they were cold. if it wasnt for the people we met there i would have prob cried to go home it was so depressing, needs a total face lift and there is lizards everywhere, freaky little things.  WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT GO THERE ITS A WASTE OF MONEY, ive had cheper all inclusive with brill service food etc for less money, will not make that mistake again!!!!

title: wont be going back for definate
review: just come back from this all inclusive joke if the cockrels dont get on your pip the being followed by cctv whilst sat by the pool till the alloted time will all inclusive is a joke at this hotel nothing allowed before 11am all to bed at 00.00 or the police may be called and youll get arrested for trying to have a good time  food very poor dont do the fried hotdog sausages   not really into rabbit  and if your a fish lover your in heaven   dont get me wrong the staff are very friendly maid service is good entertainment is very dire and poor  you need to be as fit as chris bonnington to get to the hotel one taxi driver got lost  over all i thing the holiday reps should go and take a look at this place think it got three stars from a lucky bag

title: Scouse TRUTH
review: Hi there there is no garden,no indoor swimming pool, no childrens pool, no spa tub, no air con in rooms and no satelite tv anywhere and the wifi goes off every 10 mins. All inclusive means spanish breakfast,lunch and dinner snacks from 4pm untill 6pm are leftover pastrys from lunch and ice cream pots all other snacks eg crisp lollyices ect you have to pay for. Alcohol is served from 11am - 11pm the bar area is closed at midnight and everyone must go to a club or back to there room and there is no noise allowed after this time or the police are called (this means no laughing,no talking no nothing) pool is closed at 6pm also there is a sauna,bbq pit and jaccuzi but all dont work, we spent all our money on food due to all the food not tasting very nice the only concillation is that…

title: OK but if anything goes wrong its awful!!!!!
review: Rooms big and clean but there is NO air con just a ceiling fan that moves the warm air around!  Very ltd food just your breakfast,lunch and tea, pastries from breakfast is then availble from 4pm.  Your not allowed in the bar area next to the pool in wet/damp swimming clothes and you have to wear foot wear all the time.  Our veiw was lovely over the valley but with several cockrals crowing even before dawn puts a downer on the view lol.  Food again was OK very same/same and had some very upset tummys on most days?!!  Had a french couple who argued very very loudly most nights and even went round offering "cake" but even after complaints by most gusets they were still there!!!!  We were booked in until the end of the 24th ( our coach picked us up at 11PM) but they asked us to…

title: Eat out
review: Hotel Perla disappointing. Basic hotel clean but now in need of a bit of tender loving care. Food of very poor quality. Meals were either cold or lukewarm. Some days meals from the previous day were on offer again including Paella !! Many of us suffered stomach upsets so be prepared with a supply of Imodium.

title: Won't be going back.
review: Stayed here with my boyfriend in August last year, August being a peak month and should be sunny.......no. Puerto De La Cruz is a horrible location if you want sun, don't come to this bit of tenerife, go to the south. The location of the hotel is terrible, it looks like a prison camp from the back. It is really far from everywhere, there is a bus available but it just takes time. We were looking for a beach all day, it was nowhere to be found. We went both sides of the hotel, nothing. We found a dock, that's the only thing you can find, it's terrible, horrible colour of the sea and the actual sea looks dangerous. The rooms, are a decent size. The TV, just spanish channels, except english news (which I might be fussy but were going to another hotel which has ITV, BBC and so…

title: The world's your oyster
review: So long as the sun shines, Puerto de la Cruz is a far better destination than the package tour nightmares on the South coast.  The old town retains character and because it's a 'proper' town and not just a resort, it has a good variety of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.  The Atlantic rollers make for very exciting swimming and wave watching.  Try a swim at high tide in the small, oldest harbour near the Lido.   Ah yes, the Lido.  Cheaper than hiring a sunbed on any beach, it's got excellent swimming, loads of room and top sunbathing places.  Stay all day for E3.50.  Sold.  The Perla.  Built in a residential area it's hard to find, especially arriving by car.  It's a good, easy walk downhill into town via the rear access bridge.  The walk back is also easy if you're…

title: Perfect for a Holiday on a Budget!
review: My boyfriend and I (in our mid-20's) holidayed here at the start of August 2011 for a week and we had a great time!  It was a last-minute holiday and we were on a budget, so the Perla was the perfect choice for us.  Don't expect a posh or modern hotel, it is very basic and randomly the reception is up on the 5th floor! But it was clean and going all-inclusive saved us SO much money, we could eat and drink to our hearts content =) We didn't spend too much time in the hotel, you can get free buses into the town & beach but we couldn't find it, it was only a 20-30 minute walk though and some good exercise!  The pool isn't too big but was lovely to go for a dip and there is a pool table next to it too which we spent some time on.  Our room was on the 3rd floor and mainly quiet…

title: Eat out
review: our holiday was 3 weeks 13th Dec/3rd Jan.in that time we had dinner 4 times,my advise is take extra cash for meals out.The rooms were very clean the cable TV consisted of only one English channel.When we arrived we were given a room on the 1st Floor,there are 6 floors the reception is on the ground floor and that is the 5th floor, so as we did not want to face the wall which was 8ft  away we asked to change rooms and were given one for 2 days facing the garden on the 1st floor, then we moved to the 6th floor that was fine until the entertainment (if you can call it entertainment) started at 9 O'clock on the 6th floor in the bar.We rented a car for the whole of the holiday,but if  you wanted to walk out for a drink in the evening forget it, you are to far from the bars and life…

title: Disappointed!!
review: My husband and I spent our Xmas week at the Perla, arriving on 24th December and leaving on 31st.   We were dropped off at the back entrance as the front road is too narrow for coaches, etc.   We were a bit confused at first because the back entrance is actually the ground floor corridor and we had to take the lift up to the 5th floor where the Reception is.  The Reception is a bit shabby and very busy (mostly with people waiting to complain).  The Receptionist seemed like a very cheerful guy and very helpful  -  that is until I complained about something, then he became rude and arrogant.  We didn't get a mini-bar as listed in our hotel details but we did have a small fridge which was useful for water, juice, etc.  The food was terrible and we ended up  going out for meals…

title: Excellent value for money
review: There was three of us who went away to this hotel on 2nd October for a weeks All Inclusive holiday.  We arrived at 2am and the receptionist was very helpful and spoke good English.  I found all the staff helpful during our stay. The waiters were very efficient and had a good laugh with them.  I dont know who all these rude staff are as I didnt meet any of them.  The maids do start early and a bit noisy but we got up quite early anyway.  The rooftop pool was very clean but deep everywhere so only go in if you can swim ! The food was ok, I didnt stop eating so it couldnt have been that bad.  I found the wine at dinner quite enjoyable !! All in all in my opinion it is a very clean friendly hotel, food ok, drinks great, swimming pool good, views amazing, rooms big and light.  The…

title: Didn't Enjoy
review: I guess you get what you pay for! Nothing felt special about this place, the food, the staff, the room, the facilities it was all so basic. The place lacked any nice/friendly atmosphere. You want to feel like going on holiday is a treat, but i'd rather of been at home.

title: Don't believe the photos!!!!
review: Myself and a friend stayed at the La perla for 1 week this October - the photos do not reflect this hotel. The staff are beyond rude  -aside from a nice spanish woman that works the bar through the day. The evening entertainment consists of a man on an electric keyboard or DJ Don Juan  - who does not play to everyones tastes shall we say. The food is awful - the salad is fresh daily ( I think ) but don't b suprised to see the mornings bacon and nearly raw sauaage chopped up with pasta for lunch and tea!! The hotels photos honestly have no bearing on the ' restaurant' food. The wine comes in a bottle with no lable and tastes like paint stripper. The roof top terrace is nice for the sun worshippers with good views however the beds are old and worn and do not sit up. The room was…

title: Ok, if you get a good deal!
review: Just leaving the hotel just now after a 6 day trip, What can I say!!!  First of all the hotel is one of the cleanest I have stayed in, the food is reasonable ( a lot of people unhappy with standard and ate out!)  The staff are the most dour (sad) faced people who I have ever encountered in hotels in my life!!!! They will go out their way to be unhelpful!!!  The 6 days we had there were amazing as we met up with some fellow scots some english and a fab group of French which was the true making of the holiday.  If you struggle with inclines and stairs this is definetly not a place for you, neither for kids as the pool is very deep.  On the whole the holiday was rather poor- please also note your all inclusive finishes at 12pm on the day of departure and not when you get picked up…

title: good food,poor entertainment.
review: the food was very good,the entertainment was poor.There was no rep on the day after arrival,in fact it was several days before a rep appeared,there was then even a rep on sunday.The weather was good until the final day,then there was a spot of rain.There was no details of the hotel in the room,reception number etc.There was a good view of mount teide from our room and the sea from the other side.The roof top was great for sun bathers,complete with sun beds.The so called digital tv had only two english channels,cnbc,both the same.

title: Chilled out!
review: If you are expecting 4* service & aminities this is not the palce for you. However I have just come back from a lovely destressful holiday & it was bliss!   Rooms are clean & hairdryer & toilatries are very good. Food samey, but very fresh. Bar staff & waiters are great.  If you are happy to just get away and do nothing except chill this is a great option. Great value for money!!   Please note the reception is on the fith floor & not the ground as we were expecting ha!

title: It only got better!!!
review: Have just returned from Tenerife. My first day was not good,but after 3 days I was able to change rooms. The hotel was rather nice, I was on the 5th floor at the back overlooking the birds and goats! Was peaceful.For a three star the food was very good. Im fussy so there is ALWAYS some foods that I never touch. But the salads, white fish, pasta,rice,chicken and pork were excellent.Unfortunately for my waistline, the chips were magnificent! The soups were thick hot and tasty, For the strong willed there was fresh fruit and yoghurts.I was good at breakfast time and stuck with yoghurt and rolls.The mini bus was good, the taxis back if you were truly lazy were 3euros! I loved the swimming pool, and I even went undercover on the top in the solarium. The staff were very good, and…

title: It's only a 3 star!
review: We returned from a week at the Hotel Perla on the 25th of September. Although we had a relaxing week and recharged our batteries, the hotel didn't live up to our expectations.  The first dissapointment was the food. We chose this hotel because of the earlier reviews on this site saying the food was very good but it was cheap, processed foods like chicken nuggets, burgers and even the vegetable rice that looked like it was out of a packet. The salad bar was nice but chips were on the menu twice a day every day. The breakfast to be honest was awful, the scrambled egg was very watery, anemic hot dog sausages and over cooked beans. We ended up eating out two or three nights even though we were staying all inclusive.  The hotel was very clean but the maids are really eager to get…

title: hot hot hot!!!!!!
review: We stayed in this hotel for a week from 22nd sept 2011 to 29th sept 2011 the weather was cloudy the first couple of days but you still got sun burnt. The rest of the week the sun was shining :-). Food was the same practacially all the time if you like chips and salad your ok. Puddings didnt varies jelly ice cream and mouse everyday!!!! entertainment was rubbish unless your in your 60 plus. Pool very deep not for kids. All inclusive is not what it states you get ur 3 main meals and what they call snacks is only from 3.30 till around 5 which consistes of dry couissants and cakes from breakfast time no other snacks are avaliable at any time ony ice cream. Drinks are avaliable between 11am and 11pm not before or not after!!! it states on there web site they serve cocktails which is…

title: Very good relaxing holiday
review: Me and my partner had a lovely relaxing holiday and the food was fantastic and very clean rooms everyday and the hotel was very clean aswell.thay only have one deep pool that its not for kids and this hotel is not a place for bringing kids cos there nothing do for them.it only for couples or people on there own and don't worry if u are cos we got talking to loads of English people and even ken who was on is own while we was there.if your going here don't worry if u think u come to a hotel with nothing around cos at back of hotel there a foot bridge u can cross that brings u out to shops and food places and bar and if u love up hills walking u can get to town or u can get free bus from hotel what take u there.we only found on notice board in reception area near sofa thay have…

title: good hotel but weather let it down !!!!!
review: Four adults went to this hotel , my partner and I and my son and his girlfriend.We had to request a room change because we were given a room in the basement which was clean but had a wall for the view. The reception were very understanding to move us all when I advised them that it felt damp and it was making my asthma bad.Once moved the room was very clean and we had a fab view with balcony towards Mount Teide.The food was fresh but not particularly varied but we all had plenty to eat during our stay as all inclusive.The pool was small but perfectly good enough for us but it was very deep no real shallow end !I would recommend the hotel but if you are a sun worshipper then think again!!!!!! as the clouds linger on the top of the mountain all day. We recommend Loro Parque it was…

title: goodclean hotel
review: just had a lovely two weeks at perla. we were all inclusive,and the meals we had were very good for the price we paid .Our room was at the front of the hotel and we had a lovey view of the sea it did look much closer than it was. the staff were very good our room was cleaned every day by the same lady she was lovely  Had plenty to eat and plenty to drink . the pool is smaller than expected and deep but still very nice when the sun gets too hot.only problem it is on a hill and takes about 15 minutes to walk down into town but much longer to walk back up better to use the free bus or get a taxi All in all a very good holiday and very good value for money

title: Good for the price
review: Me and my boyfriend (both of us early 20's) had a lovely time at this hotel.  We paid very little for it and it was just what we paid for.  The rooms were basic but clean, the food was limited but you could eat something everynight and the majority of the staff couldn't do enough to help you.  The hotel is located about 1km from the sea front and the beach, it takes about 20mins for a leisurely walk down, there is also a free shuttle bus and a taxi is 3.50.  The evening entertainment is non existent but there are so many nice bars on the front that we didn't find it an issue.  The main down side of this hotel was the bar staff, playing cards was forbidden and they enforced this rule.  They were often rude, stopped serving before 11pm and wouldnt let you have a soft drink or…

title: You get what you pay for
review: We had a good stay at this hotel nice room very clean plenty of food and drink.The bus to the center was a god send as taxis varied from 2--5 euros one way,the walk down was OK but unless you are fit don't walk back !!!.We would go back to this hotel but looking at the other reviews I koow what side/room to stay in.

title: Well worth the money - great value
review: Just arrived back from Tenerife, hotel perla was very clean the rooms are quite basic, very friendly staff, food was always fresh and we always found something we liked to eat.  Overall great value for money!! Drinks were really good too !! With very good measures if u had spirits! all in all great hotel !! Hotel was approx 20 mins walk from main centre/sea front beautiful area very pretty but very hilly !! Lots of resturants/shops/cafes - would definately recommend.

title: Lovely location, basic hotel.
review: We arrived at the hotel just before Midnight, and was dropped at the rear of the hotel by which can only be descrived as Big Brothers gate! We pressed all the buttons on the intercom as there were no instructions and was eventually greeted by a voice, who buzzed us in. We entered the hotel to be confronted by a long corridor with no sign of the reception - we had to ask a couple who were coming along the corridor where we should go. Eventually we found the reception on the 5th floor and checked in, the guy at reception was very helpful although his English was basic. He showed us to the restaurant where they had provided us with a simple cold meat salad, bread roll and jug of water. After this we found our room on the 4th floor overlooking the Dry River bed that you hear so much…

title: Basic but has everything you need!
review: We arrived at the hotel just before midnight and checked in. We had 4 rooms on the 1st floor. They were clean, but the terraces had a view of a wall.  We went to the bar to get water for the night at 11.58pm and were greeted by the bar man mentioned in the other reviews- he served us but begrudgingly. By this stage we weren't feeling very positive about our hotel!!! However, the next day we asked to change rooms and the receptionist was superb. He changed us to rooms on the opposite side of the hotel with lovely balconies.  The bar staff were fine.  Yes, one of them is serious, but will chat if you're friendly with him.  The rooms are basic, but clean, and the housekeeping staff were great.   The food was good- plenty of choice, and wine with each meal. The restaurant staff were…

title: We wont be back
review: The hotel is quite a distance from the main shopping/tourist area although there is a free hourly and prompt bus with a friendly driver. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The food was acceptable. The hotel at night was noisy due to guests leaving via our ground floor corridoor. The photos do not represent the current hotel as its in need of refurbishment. The rooms are clean but basic. The entertainment consists of a non speaking DJ who plays music from the 50-s to the 80s three nights week and a Spanish singer/ keyboard player twice a week. The German and Spanish guests loved it as they could waltz the night away.There is no entertainmnet during the day. This hotel is not suitable for children as theres nothing for them to do and some of them got bored and started to…

title: Great place and great value for money
review: My boyfriend and I booked an all inclusive stay for 1 week here. The hotel itself is immaculate and the food is very good. We usually eat out at least a few times even when all inclusive, but had no desire to do so as the food was varied, plentiful and always fresh. The rooms are basic but clean. Unfortunately the beds are quite uncomfortable and my boyfriend has a bad back so he really struggled. There are lots of loungers at the pool - no need to do the usual holiday thing and get up at the crack of dawn to reserve one with your towel. They are situated on a different level to the pool, which I thought was great (it was lovely and quiet with no kids about). Please beware though that although it is a very cloudy part of the island, YOU WILL GET BURNED. I fell asleep for an hour…

title: We'll definitely be back
review: Very clean hotel with friendly staff.  We were "all inclusive" which was good value.  Easier to walk to the sea front then expected, although there was an hourly minibus 7 tmes a day. Unfortunately it had a habit of not turning up, so we learned a short cut to walk which only took 15-20mins.  Quite a small pool on the roof near the bar.  Sauna (but this was extra) Beautiful views of the ocean and volcano from the hotel roof.  Plenty of sun beds, but in February it wasn't too busy so I don't know about the summer months.  Food was plentiful with ample choice, except for desserts.  Yogurt & fruit every day!!!!  Lots of fresh fruit particularly at breakfast and plenty of wine with meals when all inclusive.  This was useful as we were never told what other drinks were available with…

title: A good holiday
review: Our first all inclusive holiday and found it to be good value for money. The staff were very friendly, food was ok (just not all our taste) plenty of it and freshly cooked. No problems at the bar in getting drinks, bar did close at 11pm for all inclusive, but by then most appeared to have had enough to drink!!   Room was cleaned every day and there was no problem with cleanliness at all. Pool was small for the size of the hotel. Mixture of nationalities there, the brits were the loudest!! I would not recommend taking small children here, there is nothing for them to do except play in the pool and you need to watch them as the pool in on the roof of the hotel and no english safety standard rails, children need to be over 10.   The location is very hilly and the town is not as…

title: It was great!
review: When I first arrived at the hotel, I thought that it was not going to be as great but I was proved wrong. I arrived at the hotel with my family at around quarter past 10 at night and by that time the dining room was closed so we did not get a meal. But because of that the reception gave us a free meal on the day we leaved as we were half board. Generally the food was tasty, as there was a variety of salads and dishes. The staff were very friendly, especially the waiters. Most of them knew english, but I was able to interact with them as I knew a bit of spanish. It was quite funny, ended up having a picture taken wth them! Our rooms got cleaned every day and we were provided with new soaps and shower gels each day. The hotel is not near the shops which many people would like to…

title: More than happy with this hotel especially for he price!!!
review: Just returned from spending a week at the Perla n found all the staff helpful and friendly!  have to say that simian has covered much about the hotel already and our experience of the place was much the same although we did travel to Loro Parque (simian didnt do parks so for info only) . Loro Parque was a very good day out and we purchased the Twin Park ticket so as we could also experience Siam Water Park. Loro is a must see especially the orca, dolphin and sea lion shows, absolutely fab n well worth watching, Orca show has you laughing and is a good show and if you want to be kissed by a sea lion then i suggest you sit to the left farest side 2nd row back, fortunately i was sat on very front but did have the sea lion right next to me while he wet kissed the lady who was sat…

title: Couldn't ask for more
review: I am one of those people who spend hours looking at reviews for hotels before I commit my hard earned money and time to a holiday.  I was relatively pleased with the previous reviews I had read about the Perla and so I though my wife and I would enjoy out time there.  We were looking for a fairly quiet place with good food and not too many drunken 'kids' partying at all hours.  I think we found exactly what we were looking for here. Our transfer took an hour (we were the only people on the transfer bus, so no other drop offs), which was quicker than we expected and we were dropped off by a bridge that went across to the hotel.  We entered on the first floor and made our way up to reception on the fifth floor.   The original room we were given was perfectly nice but the view was…

title: terrible hotel.
review: miles away from anywhere, no entertainment, bar staff very rude apart from one young man who tried to make up for the others, wouldn't allow cards played in the bar, had to sit outside, pool area horrible with loungers on a nother floor up a ladder that looked like it belonged to an aircraft. only good thing was the food which u could have plenty of.  all inclusive ends at 12.00 on the day u leave even if u dont leave tii 8 in the evening. would never go back or recomend this hotel. beds terrible too.

title: Excellent value for money
review: Rooms cleaned daily and fresh towels every day.  Really relaxing holiday.  Staff were very friendly and helpful. Food good and varied, hot and lots of it. Branded soft drinks - pepsi, fanta and 7up included in All inclusive deal.  Quiet location, just a 20 min walk to the town or get the free bus from the hotel.  Would def. go back to this hotel.

title: Not What I was Expecting....
review: Where to begin! Not the most horrendous experience... but yet not the best! The cleanliness, general appearance, waitering staff, reception staff and other guests were all beyond satisfactory. As for the Bar staff... Quite easily ruined the holiday! During the day they offered no entertainment... not even a smile! It was rather shamefull on the hotels behalf that they allowed the most miserable bunch to be on the bar. My other half and i went all inclusive and i can assure you we paid for the holiday, which as far as i'm concerned is generally how an all inclusive holiday works, yet they begrudged us every drink that  they gave us and even had the cheek to ask us when we were leaving! We were having a few quiet drink and playing cards most of the week with a few couples we met…

title: Do not go to this hotel, staff were very rude. made our family holiday hell.
review: its like a prison, cant do anything, not a hotel for children.....we were all really ill so had to stay in bed for 2 days, could not even bring a bowl of soup to room for my sick father. Do not book this hotel if u have children or want to enjoy yourselfs!!!!

title: Reasonable standard not as advertised
review: The hotel itself was to a reasonable standard, its staff were friendly and helped for an enjoyable stay. The food was good and the menu was varied. The room was small and not to the standard portrayed in the pictures on their website. The bed was very uncomfortable and would recommend going all inclusive to allow you enough drinks to overcome this issue. If you are hoping for a peaceful break this is probably not the hotel for you as it has very thin walls and very noisy cleaners. This hotel would benefit some money being spent upgrading the facilities in the rooms to bring it back to the 3 stars it advertises.  To no fault of the hotel Northern Tenerife does suffer with a lot of cloudy days even when the South is basking in Sunshine.

title: We liked it, but would not go back!!
review: Hotel was fine, a few faults (no a/c in the bedrooms) but on the whole the staff were very attentive. The only thing reason they did not get 5 stars is the attitude of the bar staff.....One barman in particular (a big, no neck ugly bugger) who should be no where near people trying to enjoy themselves. He seem to think the all inclusive bar was coming out of his pocket...would only serve you when he was ready and very rude when he did.......We would never go back until he's gone!! What a shame

title: very clean hotel
review: My friend and I stayed there for a week at the beginning of July to relax after finishing our degrees! And relax we did!   The rooms are basic...but you don't spend time in them anyway! My friend said her bed was a bit hard, mine was fine but I can sleep anywhere!   Food was good - huge salad selection, and ALWAYS fish on (I don't like fish so some nights it was a bit boring because there would often only be one meat option). And deserts are the standard "non- English" deserts that we always moan about abroad!   The area we were really disappointed with. There is not much to do unless you have the cash !!!!! It is a cheap hotel and holiday but when you get there to actually do things it will mount up. Other holidays I have been on you can just walk places and there is so much to…

title: Great value for money hotel!
review: We've just got back from a week's stay at Perla, and don't really have a bad word to say about the hotel. The decor is a bit dated, and there are a few odd bits (like the reception is on the 5th floor, and the pool on the roof terrace) but the hotel is clean, the food is great and the staff are helpful. The only bad thing was the other guests - on our last night we were kept awake by people shouting from balcony to balcony at 1am, but this isn't the hotel's fault.   The food is a buffet service, and there was plenty to choose from. As someone with a wheat intolerance I usually struggle abroad, but there was plenty of salad (always fresh), two or three meat dishes, sides e.g. canarian potatoes (scrummy!) and a fish dish. There was plenty of choice for pudding as well, with fruit,…

title: on the whole an excellent trip
review: Rooms- cleaned daily and immaculate, non smoking and altho i am a smoker i prefer a room not to smell, good size with a fridge and safe(deposit req) views not great but not an issue Staff- absolutely amazing, very willing and friendly Pool- small and deep loungers on the roof upstairs ideal for the sun(when it comes) be careful of the metal stairs as they are very slippery when wet Food- again amazing, well cooked and different daily Entertainment- this is where the hotel is a letdown...Pedro on his keyboard!!! and a disco, which to be fair if you dance(like we did) it can be a giggle no other entertainment and bar closes at 12.00 dead on so its either bed or town as there is nowhere else to sit. Best advice to give is hire a car and do some sight seeing as it can be…

title: Very good with no complaints
review: Just got back after a fun filled week. If you're boring and are planning on sitting in the Hotel all week then don't expect too much.   There is plenty to do in the local area if you have a little imagination or even more if you don't mind sepending a few pennies (water park, zoo, island tours etc...). I advise that you hire a car, it works out cheeper; 18euros a day for a for kia which is the lowest level and fuel cost half the price as mainland europe.      I was impressed with the food and drink (beware alchol is watered down, when you get on it down town you realise quickly realise how smashed you get). Wide variaty of food, although some people complained of upset stomachs, I survived.      Staff are polite and helpful. If you tip they become even more so. Rooms are cleaned…

title: What a cracking time we had!!
review: We had a week in this hotel, I have never had so much fun on holiday, full of Geordie lasses, and many others!! We had a great time watching my partner fall out the jacuzzi, Sally fall down the stairs and me being blind drunk, the portions were great and plenty of beer flowing, well there was till I showed up, the reception staff were fantastic & the waiters at the dining was really helpful (except the women with demencha who asked for our card EVERY time!! I went to this hotel allergic to fish, I come back anorexic! There was plenty... Of fish to choose from and the chef makes a great onelete! All in all, it was amazing!!  Thanks amazing friends & thanks Perla Tenerife!!  All the best, Jamie & Emma x

title: Brilliant value for money
review: We are a couple in our 60s and liked the atmosphere: very pleasant and relaxed. There was a wide variety of nationalities and everyone got on fine. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is situated in a quiet residential area and there is a regular minibus to the town centre, from which you can walk to the beach. A variety of facilities are in easy reach and I noticed an unusually large number of tennis courts. The weather is cloudy and if you want sun, catch a bus to the other side of the island or hire a car. The local temperature hovered around 65 fahrenheit most of our stay, which made it pleasant for strolling around. We recommend the botanic garden just up the road. The orchid garden down the hill was closed for renovation but reopens on July…

title: Great hotel!
review: We stayed in this hotel for one week and have 2 rooms.  ROOMS: - clean, big with balcony and TV. Safe is very small and not suitable for netbook and is for 15 EUR per week.Beds were quite comfortable. FOOD: great! - especially canarian quisine was delicious, however international was perfect, too. Wide selection. title: basic but very chilled break!
review: Just returned from Hotel La Perla in Tenerife after a 10 night stay, Me and my boyfriend ages mid 20s, we struggled to find a hotel in tenerife with good reviews, however after reading a few we decided to book up, first of all the journey from the airport is about an hour and a half so make sure you have tranfers, otherwise you will pay a fortune, once you get to the hotel it is strange layout with 6foors the reception being on the 5th floor and bar and sunloungers higher, hardly any english people mostly 60+ couples who speak spanish, no daytime entertainment and evening entertainment was all spanish. Drinks and food however can not fault breakfast the usual fry up,fruit and toast,lunch and dinner meat veg and chips and during our stay the food was only repeated about 2 or…

title: Wow Where Do I Start
review: When I booked an all inclusive holiday I didnt realise it would be an all inclusive!!!!!!  Holiday at this Hotel. How can I put it. The Bar Staff are (Very attentive to your needs).  If You are a Women that has been cheated on, dumped or divorced then this is the place for you to have some fun!!!!. Age is not a problem as all is catered for.  If you are looking for somewhere that is children friendly this is not the place for you. All entertainment is in spanish so if you dont speak spanish then you will be bored. Young couples should stay well clear.  you could mistake the hotel as a retirement home. This Hotel is for Spanish people going on their holidays. title: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC - COULD NOT FAULT IT
review: We have just returned literally 24 hours ago and would go back today - had a fantastic 10 night stay and the staff were so friendly.    The food was amazing, never stuck for choice - no day time animation but we had 4 or 5 discos while we were there and danced the night away - loved it.

title: Nice Place
review: After several business trips in the UK and the resulting over night staying with all the typically English problems like untidiness, high prices for nothing unspeakable food, now a holiday trip to Tenerife. What a surprise only a 3 star hotel with good food, quiet atmosphere, friendly service and a fair price. Thank Goodness for the hospitality in other European Countries. Gives you the good feeling of being treated as a valued customer. Thanks Perla Tenerife. When we go back to Tenerife it will be the Perla Tenerife again.

title: you get what you pay for
review: although it has three stars,  it really is one maybe two stars.  very basic..............food not good   bad beds   nice town thank goodness..............you certainly get what you pay for.................after the third day wanted to return home

title: Great value stay at the Perla Tenerife
review: We had a great value 2 week all-inclusive stay at the Perla Tenerife - me, my wife and our daughter (41,41,4).  The hotel is well out of the way, about 20 minutes' walk from the seafront.  If you want to spend loads of time on the beach, the distance will get to you.  There is a free coach running approximately 7 times a day from the hotel to the centre of town, and that's a very useful service, but not quite the same as being in the centre of things and doesn't run in the evenings.  All of that said, the location is quiet and relaxing - whereas most of the town centre hotels are quite noisy.  We found the food fine - but if you are fussy, you will get bored on a two week stay.  The bar gave generous measures and no silly rules about one drink per person at a time or anything…
